summary:
## Greenland Shark

Greenland sharks are huge, living in the cold North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans. They're the longest-lived vertebrate, possibly surviving up to 500 years! These ancient sharks grow slowly, reaching sexual maturity around 150 years old. They eat all sorts of food, even dead animals (carrion). Their meat is toxic to most mammals, but Icelanders prepare it as a special dish called kæstur hákarl. Despite their size, Greenland sharks are harmless to humans as they live in deep, remote waters.
title: Greenland shark
